text: Access the Figma prototype via this link. Are you able to view the prototype?
Having accessed the prototype, how difficult was it for you to identify the Shazam icon on the interface. Rate from 1(easy to identify) to 5(hard to identify).
Having accessed the prototype, how difficult was it to add the song after Shazam had identified it. Rate from 1(easy to identify) to 5(hard to identify).
Having accessed the prototype, how difficult is it for you to navigate back to the previous screen, after using Shazam, if you chose not to add the song? Rate from 1(very easy) to 5(not very easy).
On a scale of 1 to 5, how usable of a feature do you think this would be? Rate from 1(very usable) to 5(not very usable).
How satisfied are you with this feature?

answers: I think more explanation of what Shazam does could be helpful for some viewers
It should be able to return if user click it by accident
Great work. I always thought that Spotify at some point would add this feature for better search performance. Great to see at least someone acknowledged this issue and added it to prototype.

After adding a song, don't make the "plus" icon disappear. Follow Spotify (and UI) conventions by retaining the button on the screen and showing feedback through changed color (e.g. Spotify changes the plus icon to a green checkmark icon).
great feature for those who love to know the song details they are currently hearing
Very cool addition to an already successful app

You should make it somewhere the Shazam button is accessible all the time for the user instead of just linked to a playlist. Maybe somewhere on the bottom of the screen where menu options usually like search and library

When the song is added to the playlist, some type of confirmation that the action was successfully performed (like a green checkmark) would help. Also I noticed that there was the option on the Shazam page to add the top related songs to your playlist as well. That could use the same type of confirmation symbol so users know it was successfully added.
the shazam button could be slightly more obvious
I think the abilitity to add other related songs to the one being listened to is a great feature for music discoverability,
An option to add the shazamed song to a particular playlist
I like how there are other recommended songs that can be added to the playlist after the song is Shazam'd
